thread.title: Dumped in a squalid coal shed: Sick dog 'left to die a slow, horrible death'
thread.title_full: Dumped in a squalid coal shed: Sick dog 'left to die a slow, horrible death'

title: Dumped in a squalid coal shed: Sick dog 'left to die a slow, horrible death'
text: Dumped in a squalid coal shed: Sick dog 'left to die a slow, horrible death' Dumped in a squalid coal shed: Sick dog 'left to die a slow, horrible death' HEARTLESS animal abusers abandoned this sick dog to die barricaded inside a cramped and pitch black coal shed. PUBLISHED: 00:00, Tue, Feb 21, 2017 | UPDATED: 11:08, Tue, Feb 21, 2017 RSPCA Animal abusers abandoned this sick dog to die in a pitch black coal shed Only when the dumped pet's pitiful cries were heard by a passer by was she finally freed from her nightmare inside the squalid living tomb. There was no water, food or bedding left for the terrified dog and it is impossible to say how long she had been scratching and howling inside the shed attached to a derelict house. The RSPCA has launched a major investigation into the neglect case, saying the nine-year-old dog had been abandoned to endure a slow and lingering death suffering from untreated tumours. Related articles Dog owners face Â£50K legal bill in fight to save terrier from eviction As soon as the dog was freed from the shed at the property in Middlesex Road, Hull, last week, she immediately jumped on to an RSPCA inspector's lap for fussing. Animal carers have called the dog Cassie and there are plans for her to undergo surgery to a huge mammary tumour and a bleeding and open lump on her shoulder in coming days. It was only a piece of luck that saved the dog. RSPCA The nine-year-old dog had been abandoned to endure a slow and lingering death RSPCA There was no water, food or bedding left for the terrified dog There was no water, no food and no bedding in the space. As soon as I opened the door, she rushed out David Milborrow RSPCA Inspector David Milborrow, who is investigating the case, said: "A woman had heard the dog but couldn't see her because she'd been barricaded inside a tiny coal shed that was built onto the side of a derelict house. "We don't know how long she'd been locked in that tiny, cramped room but the houses in this area have been boarded up for some time so it's lucky that someone passed by and heard her cries. "The space was just 3ft-square and the dog had been shut inside in total darkness. She must have been terrified. The world's ugliest dogs Sat, June 27, 2015 The World's Ugliest Dog competition in Petaluma, California. The competition which honours lovable, but aesthetically challenged, dogs previously rejected by society for their unique appearance.
